meanings.definition: To shout 'hurray' in celebration or approval.
meanings.sent1: The team was hurraying after winning the game.
meanings.sent2: People were hurraying at the parade.
meanings.sent3: The children started hurraying when they found out about the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The crowd kept hurraying, filling the stadium with excitement.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't help hurraying when she received the good news.

meanings.definition: The act of cheering or expressing joy with shouts of 'hurray'.
meanings.sent1: The loud hurraying echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The hurraying of the fans could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected hurraying made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The hurraying of the audience was music to his ears.
meanings.sent5: The room filled with hurraying as the announcement was made.

meanings.definition: A series of loud, enthusiastic cheers or shouts of 'hurray'.
meanings.sent1: The continuous hurraying lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent2: The hurraying of the crowd was contagious.
meanings.sent3: The hurraying at the party was so loud it startled the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The hurraying of the supporters filled the stadium with energy.
meanings.sent5: The hurraying created a joyful atmosphere at the event.
